context_meta.title: Paul George's Hip Injury Diagnosed as Contusion; Will Undergo Further Evaluation
context_meta.summary: Oklahoma City Thunder star Paul George suffered a right hip contusion in his team's 116-108 playoff victory over the Utah Jazz on Sunday at Chesapeake Energy Arena, ESPN.com's Royce Young reported. George will have the hip evaluated Monday to determine the extent of the injury. The five-time All-Star finished with a game-high 36 points in Sunday's first-round Game 1 win. George has more than delivered on expectations after landing in Oklahoma City in a trade from the Indiana Pacers. He's averaged 21.9 points, 5.7 rebounds and 3.3 assists in his first season with the Thunder. He has also been the team's best three-point shooter, hitting 40.1 percent of his attempts from beyond the arc. According

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: How Lance Stephenson made an impact, literally, against LeBron James in Game 1
context_meta.summary: Lance Stephenson didn't waste any time making an impact in the Indiana Pacers' series against the Cleveland Cavaliers. He gave LeBron James a really hard (but common) foul, drove for a monster dunk (and head-butted the basket support), hit a corner 3-pointer and more -- and that was all in the first quarter. Lance had 9 points and 4 rebounds as the Pacers led 55-38 at halftime. Stephenson clubbed James on the head late in the third quarter. Lance gets a personal foul and a technical foul, but it's not a flagrant foul. Stephenson finished with 12 points and 5 rebounds in Indiana's 98-80 win. context_meta.title: Record turnout for Jimbo's A&M spring game
context_meta.summary: Sam Khan Jr. ESPN Staff Writer Close Covers Texas A&M and the SEC. Joined ESPN in 2012. Graduate of the University of Houston. Follow on Twitter COLLEGE STATION, Texas -- A Texas A&M spring football game record crowd turned out to usher in the unofficial on-field start of the Jimbo Fisher era. The Aggies and their new coach provided observers their first glance of what's ahead after Fisher's highly publicized offseason move to A&M from Florida State at Saturday's annual Maroon & White game at Kyle Field. context_meta.title: Three observations from Warriors' dominant Game 1 win: Is there a spy in the Spurs' locker room?
context_meta.summary: SportsPulse: USA TODAY Sports' NBA experts break down the key story lines heading into the Western Conference playoffs. OAKLAND – The champs stayed off the ropes. When it comes to the ailing Golden State Warriors and their quest for a third title in four years, that was the main takeaway from Game 1 of their first-round playoff series against San Antonio at Oracle Arena on Saturday. After all that discussion about how they were in trouble, how losing 10 of 17 games amid all those injuries to close the regular season meant they just might get Buster Douglas-ed right at the start, they came out swinging instead with a 113-92 win. Here are three early observations from their opener. 1. No Steph
